info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 11 at 12:57PM AKDT until April 13 at 8:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of about 5 to 8 inches around Goodnews Bay, with locally higher amounts near Cape Newenham. Easterly winds gusting as high as 30-40 mph, with higher gusts near Cape Newenham. Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times due to blowing snow.
* WHERE...Western Capes.
* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 8 AM AKDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Heavy snow may lead to slick roads. Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow may significantly reduce visibility tonight.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two storms moving near the Western Capes will bring a long duration of snowfall. Gusty winds tonight could lead to periods of reduced visibilities in blowing snow, especially along the immediate coast. Temperatures increase into the mid-30s tomorrow afternoon, which may reduce snow accumulations during the daytime.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM AKDT SUNDAY
